DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not an in utero diagnostic test was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The period of time during which the embryo or fetus is present in the uterus of the female. Also describes the location of the embryo or fetus as being in the uterus in contrast to outside the uterus (ex utero)._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
